settings.title: Speed Warning Threshold
settings.help: If Y surface speed is not within this percentage of X surface speed, a warning will be displayed, prompting the user to update the Y max rate.

settings.title: Report Interval
settings.help: How frequently the firmware is polled for position and status information. Recommended no greater than 5Hz (0.2s). High polling frequencies may cause issues.

settings.title: Polling Interval
settings.help: How frequently the GUI requests updates (including logs) from the backend. Shorter intervals means messages are more up-to-date.

settings.title: Log History Length
settings.help: Maximum logs to keep in logs window

settings.title: Z Height
settings.help: Distance between zero (at microswitch), and the part axis, in the Z direction.

settings.title: Z Lift
settings.help: How far the pen moves from the part when not printing.

settings.title: Z Offset
settings.help: If the pen is too high or low when attempting to print, adjust this offset value. Positive values move the pen closer to the part, negative values move it further away.

settings.title: Batch Origin
settings.help: Distance between batch axis zero, and the first part being aligned under the print head.

settings.title: Batch Offset
settings.help: Distance between each component in batch axis.

settings.title: Colour Origin
settings.help: Distance between colour axis zero, and the first colour aligning with the part.

settings.title: Colour Offset
settings.help: Distance between each colour in colour axis.

settings.title: Length of Step Pulse
settings.help: Length of pulse sent to stepper motors. You want the pulses as short as the drivers can reliably recognise. If the pulses are too long, overlap between pulses can cause issues at high speeds.

settings.title: Step Idle Delay
settings.help: Every time the printer completes a motion and comes to a stop, the stepper motors will be disabled after this delay. Lower values may help account for motors which do not like to be left on for long periods of time without doing anything. Alternatively, set to the maximum value of 255 to never disable stepper motors.

settings.title: Step Port Invert
settings.help: Used to invert some or all stepper driver pulses. By default, a step event starts low, goes high, and then resets low again. When inverted, normal is high and pulse is low. View mask table.

settings.title: Direction Port Invert
settings.help: Invert the direction signal for each axis. Used if one axis is reverse what is expected. View mask table.

settings.title: Step Enable Invert
settings.help: Invert the enable pin for each axis. Used if steppers are active when they should be disabled, and vice-versa. May require a power cycle to apply.

settings.title: Limit Pins Invert
settings.help: Control whether limit pins are held high (0) or low (1). May require a power cycle to apply.

settings.title: Probe Pin Invert
settings.help: Control whether probe pin is held high (0) or low (1). May require a power cycle to apply.

settings.title: Junction Deviation
settings.help: Used by the acceleration manager to determine input velocity upon approaching a line segment junction within the GCODE file. Higher values give faster motion through corners, while increasing the risk that steps and position are lost. If you want to speed up cornering speed, increase this number. If you are loosing steps while cornering, decrease this number.

settings.title: Arc Tolerance
settings.help: The firmware converts G2 / G3 circles, arcs, and helixes as a subdivision of small lines. This value is the maximum deviation when subdividing. Supplied GCODE conversion tools do not use G2 / G3 functions, however custom GCODE might.

settings.title: Report Unit
settings.help: Toggles between firmware reporting in mm (0) or inches (1)... if for some reason you wanted freedom units.

settings.title: Soft Limits
settings.help: If enabled (1), firmware will check each GCODE command is within defined maximum travel limits. If a command is not within these limits, an immediate feed hold is issued, and the system alarm is activated. (0) disabled this functionality.

settings.title: Hard limits
settings.help: Using connected limit switches, firmware will halt all motion if a switch is hit. An infinite alarm will be triggered, and a full reset will be required. Enable limits with (1) or disable with (0)

settings.title: Homing Cycle
settings.help: Enables (1) or disables (0) the homing cycle. Only really useful for testing and debugging, as without completing a homing cycle the firmware will not know where any of the stepper motors are.

settings.title: Homing Direction Invert
settings.help: By default, firmware assumes all homing limit switches are in the positive direction. This will allow axes to have limit switches instead, in the negative direction. View mask table.

settings.title: Homing Feed Rate
settings.help: Slower movement speed during homing operation.

settings.title: Homing Seek Rate
settings.help: Faster movement speed during homing operation.

settings.title: Homing Debounce
settings.help: Debounce delay when reading microswitches. Used only when homing. Set this value to whatever results in repeatable homing.

settings.title: Homing Pull Off
settings.help: Helps when hard limits are enabled; the machine will pull off limit switches after homing by this amount. This helps prevent accidental triggering during normal operation. Make sure this value is large enough to clear the limit switch.

settings.title: Laser Mode
settings.help: When enabled (1), machine will move continuously between consecutive G1, G2, and G3 motions. When disabled, machine will operate more like a conventional CNC machine, pausing movement to allow spindle speed changes. This should not be required.

settings.title: Camera Pin Invert
settings.help: If the camera lights and laser come on when you want them off, invert change this setting

settings.title: Step Ratio (X)
settings.help: Number of steps per mm of pen movement in X axis

settings.title: Step Ratio (Y)
settings.help: Number of steps per ° of part rotation

settings.title: Step Ratio (Z)
settings.help: Number of steps per mm of pen movement in Z axis

settings.title: Step Ratio (A Batch)
settings.help: Number of steps per mm of pen movement in A axis

settings.title: Step Ratio (B Colour)
settings.help: Number of steps per mm of pen movement in B axis

settings.title: Max Rate (X)
settings.help: Maximum rate at which stepper motor controlling X axis will run. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Max Rate (Y)
settings.help: Maximum rate at which stepper motor controlling Y axis will run. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Max Rate (Z)
settings.help: Maximum rate at which stepper motor controlling Z axis will run. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Max Rate (A Batch)
settings.help: Maximum rate at which stepper motor controlling A axis will run.

settings.title: Max Rate (B Colour)
settings.help: Maximum rate at which stepper motor controlling B axis will run.

settings.title: Acceleration (X)
settings.help: Maximum acceleration of X axis during motion. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Acceleration (Y)
settings.help: Maximum acceleration of Y axis during motion. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Acceleration (Z)
settings.help: Maximum acceleration of Z axis during motion. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Acceleration (A Batch)
settings.help: Maximum acceleration of A axis during motion. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Acceleration (B Colour)
settings.help: Maximum acceleration of B axis during motion. Can be tuned by increasing until steppers stall, and then set 10-20% below this value.

settings.title: Max Travel (X)
settings.help: Maximum travel of X axis during motion.

settings.title: Max Travel (Y)
settings.help: Maximum travel of Y axis during motion. Should be set high to avoid errors.

settings.title: Max Travel (Z)
settings.help: Maximum travel of Z axis during motion.

settings.title: Max Travel (A Batch)
settings.help: Maximum travel of A axis during motion.

settings.title: Max Travel (B Colour)
settings.help: Maximum travel of B axis during motion.
